questions.question: How are the core principles and obligations of the Maritime Labour Convention (MLC) 2006 structured?
options: They are detailed only in the Code Part B guidelines
They are set out in the Articles and Regulations, with implementation details in the Code
They are contained solely within the Declaration of Maritime Labour Compliance (DMLC)
They are published separately by each flag administration
questions.answer: They are set out in the Articles and Regulations, with implementation details in the Code
questions.explanation: The Articles and Regulations define core rights and obligations, while the Code provides the practical implementation standards.

questions.question: Which two parts make up the MLC Code, and what is the main difference between them?
options: Part A (mandatory standards) and Part B (non-mandatory guidelines)
Part 1 (national) and Part 2 (international)
Part A (administrative) and Part B (operational)
Part I (optional provisions) and Part II (recommended practices)
questions.answer: Part A (mandatory standards) and Part B (non-mandatory guidelines)
questions.explanation: The Code consists of mandatory standards (Part A) and guidance (Part B), supporting consistent MLC implementation.

questions.question: What are the five Titles under which the MLC Regulations and Code are organized?
options: Title 1: Minimum requirements; Title 2: Conditions of employment; Title 3: Accommodation, recreation, food and catering; Title 4: Health protection, medical care, welfare and social security; Title 5: Compliance and enforcement
Title 1: Maritime safety; Title 2: Pollution prevention; Title 3: Crew welfare; Title 4: Insurance; Title 5: Certification
Title 1: Management; Title 2: HR; Title 3: Technical; Title 4: Operational; Title 5: Audit
Title 1: Recruitment; Title 2: Pay; Title 3: Training; Title 4: Welfare; Title 5: Environment
questions.answer: Title 1: Minimum requirements; Title 2: Conditions of employment; Title 3: Accommodation, recreation, food and catering; Title 4: Health protection, medical care, welfare and social security; Title 5: Compliance and enforcement
questions.explanation: These five Titles cover all essential areas of seafarers’ working and living conditions and the mechanisms for enforcement.

questions.question: Which statement best describes the organization of the MLC’s Regulations and Code under the Titles?
options: Each Title focuses on unrelated administrative issues
Each Title groups provisions around a specific right, principle, or enforcement measure
Titles are chronological records of the MLC’s revision history
Titles represent national annexes of the MLC
questions.answer: Each Title groups provisions around a specific right, principle, or enforcement measure
questions.explanation: Each MLC Title focuses on a thematic area, ensuring comprehensive coverage of seafarer rights and enforcement mechanisms.

questions.question: What are the two important terms introduced in this Chapter that relate to MLC compliance documentation?
options: ISM Manual and Safety Management Certificate
Declaration of Maritime Labour Compliance (DMLC) and Maritime Labour Certificate
Ship Safety Equipment Certificate and DOC
Port State Control Report and Class Endorsement
questions.answer: Declaration of Maritime Labour Compliance (DMLC) and Maritime Labour Certificate
questions.explanation: These two documents demonstrate compliance with MLC requirements—the DMLC details implementation, and the MLC Certificate verifies compliance.

questions.question: What is the function of the Declaration of Maritime Labour Compliance (DMLC) under the MLC framework?
options: To record cargo manifest and stability data
To outline how the ship and Company comply with each applicable MLC requirement
To provide a list of company policies unrelated to crew welfare
To serve as the ship’s certificate of registry
questions.answer: To outline how the ship and Company comply with each applicable MLC requirement
questions.explanation: The DMLC serves as the compliance roadmap, showing how MLC requirements are implemented by the Company and verified by authorities.
